DTMC module¶

class dtmc.DTMC(P, states_by_label=None)¶

Initializes a new DTMC.

Parameters

  • P (scipy.sparse.dok_matrix) – A (NxN) matrix that contains the transition probabilities

  • states_by_label (Dict[str, Set[int]], optional) – A function that assigns labels (string) to sets of states, defaults to None

static from_file(label_file_path, tra_file_path)¶

Creates a DTMC from a model specified by a set of labels and transitions.

Parameters

  • label_file_path (str) – the file describing state labels (type is .lab)

  • tra_file_path (str) – the file describing state transitions (type is .tra)

Returns

the resulting DTMC

Return type

dtmc.DTMC

static from_prism_model(model_file_path, prism_constants={}, extra_labels={})¶

Initializes a new DTMC from a PRISM model

Parameters

  • model_file_path (str) – file path of model without file type (e.g. tra or lab)

  • prism_constants (Dict[str,int], optional) – A dictionary of constants to be assigned in the model, defaults to {}

  • extra_labels (Dict[str,str], optional) – A dictionary that defines additional labels (than the ones defined in the prism module) to be added to the .lab file. The keys are label names and the values are PRISM expressions over the module variables, defaults to {}

Returns

the DTMC

Return type

dtmc.DTMC

graphviz_digraph(state_map=None, trans_map=None)¶

creates a graphviz.Digraph object from this DTMC.

Parameters

  • state_map ((stateidx, labels) -> {"color" : str, "label" : str, "enable" : bool} , optional) – a function that is able to enable/disable states and computes a color and a label, defaults to None

  • trans_map ((sourceidx, destidx, sourcelabels, destlabels, p) -> {"color" : str, "label" : str, "enable" : bool}, optional) – a function that is able to enable/disable state transitions and computes a color and a label, defaults to None

Returns

the Digraph

Return type

graphviz.Digraph

labels_by_state()¶

inverse of dtmc.states_by_label, i.e. gives a dictionary that specifies a set of labels for each state.

Returns

the dictionary

Return type

Dict[int, Set[str]]

static reachable(P, initial, mode)¶

returns the set of all states that are forward or backwards reachable from a set of states

Parameters

  • P (scipy.sparse.dok_matrix) – the transition matrix

  • initial (Set[int]) – initial set of states for the reachability check

  • mode (str) – either “forward” or “backward”; the reachability mode

Returns

the set of states that are reachable

Return type

Set[int]

reduce(initial_label, targets_label)¶

Creates a reduced DTMC from a given transition matrix, an initial state (index) and a set of target states (indices). Will do a forwards (states which are reachable from the initial state) and backwards (states which are able to reach the target states) reachability test on the states of the given DTMC. Removes states which fail the forwards reachability test. Will also remap all target states to a single new target state and all fail states (states which fail the backwards reachability test) to one single fail state.

Parameters

  • initial_label (str) – the label of the initial state, which must yield exactly one initial state

  • targets_label (str) – the label of the target states, which must yield at least one target state

Returns

the reduced DTMC

Return type

dtmc.ReducedDTMC

save(filepath)¶

Saves the .tra and .lab-file according to the given filepath

Parameters

filepath (str) – the file path

Returns

path of .tra and .lab-file

Return type

Tuple[str,str]

states_by_label()¶

A dictionary that yields a set of states for each label.

Returns

the dictionary

Return type

Dict[str, Set[int]]

class dtmc.ReducedDTMC(P, to_target, initial)¶

Creates a DTMC from a given transition matrix (not containing reachability probabilities from or to the target state), a vector containing the probabilties of reaching the target state in one step (to_target= \(b\)) and a given initial state index. This is equivalent to giving the DTMC in the form \(x = P x + b\).

Parameters

  • P (scipy.sparse.dok_matrix) – (NxN) transition matrix

  • to_target (np.ndarray) – probability of reaching the target state in one step

  • initial (int) – index of the initial state

as_dtmc()¶

creates a DTMC from this ReducedDTMC.

Returns

the DTMC

Return type

dtmc.DTMC

MDP module¶

class mdp.MDP(P, index_by_state_action, states_by_label=None)¶

Initializes a MDP.

Parameters

  • P (scipy.sparse.dok_matrix) – A (C x N) matrix where N is the number of states of the MDP, and C is the number of active state-action pairs. A row gives the probabilistic distribution over successor states for some state-action pair.

  • index_by_state_action (bidict.bidict) – A bidirectional dictionary that maps a state-action pair to its index in the matrix P.

  • states_by_label (Dict[str, Set[int]], optional) – A dictionary that defines labels over the MDP. Each label is mapped to a subset of the states, defaults to None

static reachable(P, index_by_state_action, initial, mode)¶

Computes the set of states that are either forwards and backwards reachable from some given state.

Parameters

  • P (scipy.sparse.dok_matrix) – the transition matrix

  • index_by_state_action (bidict.bidict) – a mapping from state-action pairs to an index set \(\{0,\dots,C\}\)

  • initial (Set[int]) – set of initial states

  • mode (str) – either “forward” or “backward”, indicating the direction of search

Returns

the set of all forwards or backwards reachable states

Return type

Set[int]

reduce(initial_label, targets_label)¶

Creates a reduced MDP from a given transition matrix, an initial state (index) and a set of target states (indices). Will do a forwards (states which are reachable from the initial state) and backwards (states which are able to reach the target states) reachability test on the states of the given MDP. Removes states which fail the forwards reachability test. Will also remap all target states to a single new target state and all fail states (states which fail the backwards reachability test) to one single fail state.

Parameters

  • initial_label (str) – the label of the initial state, which must yield exactly one initial state

  • targets_label (str) – the label of the target states, which must yield at least one target state

Returns

the reduced MDP

Return type

mdp.ReducedMDP

filepath (str) – the file path

Returns

path of .tra-file, path of .lab-file

Return type

Tuple[str,str]

Prism module¶

prism.parse_label_file(filepath)¶

Parses a .lab-file

Parameters

filepath (str) – the filepath

Returns

a dictionary mapping labels to states, a dictionary mapping states to labels, a dictionary mapping indices to labels

Return type

Tuple[Dict[str,Set[int]], Dict[int,Set[str]], Dict[int,str]]

prism.prism_to_tra(model_path, destination_path, prism_constants={}, extra_labels={})¶

Translates a prism model into an explicit representation as .tra,.sta,.lab files. To this end prism is called, which needs to be present in the path. In order to add additional labels to the model, the model file is copied into a temporary file which is appended by the label declarations.

The command that is executed is:

prism filepath -const [C=j for (C,j) in prism_constants] -exportmodel destination_path.tra,sta,lab
Parameters

  • model_path (str) – A prism model file (.nm,.pm)

  • destination_path (str) – a filepath without extension where the resulting explicit model files are written to. For example, passing “FILE” will create the files “FILE.tra”, “FILE.lab” and “FILE.sta”.

  • prism_constants (Dict[str, int], optional) – A dictionary of constants to be assigned in the model, defaults to {}

  • extra_labels (Dict[str, str], optional) – A dictionary that defines additional labels (than the ones defined in the prism module) to be added to the .lab file. The keys are label names and the values are PRISM expressions over the module variables. Defaults to {}

Returns

True, if model was constructed successfully, otherwise False.

Return type

bool

Vizualization module¶

graphviz_utils.color_from_hash(obj)¶

Derives an inidividual color from an object that can be used for a graphviz-graph. It does so by calculating the hash-code of the object which then maps to the respective color.

Parameters

obj – some object

Returns

a valid graphviz-coloring

Return type

str
